meanings.definition: A stalk that supports the fruiting body of certain fungi.
meanings.sent1: The carpophore of the mushroom held up its spores.
meanings.sent2: The carpophore of the fungus was strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent3: The carpophore of the mushroom decided to take a break from carrying spores.
meanings.sent4: The carpophore stood tall like a tiny tree in the forest of fungi.
meanings.sent5: The carpophore swayed gently in the breeze, showcasing its important role.

meanings.definition: A structure that bears the fruit in certain plants.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree's carpophore held the ripe fruits for all to see.
meanings.sent2: The carpophore of the strawberry plant was full of juicy berries.
meanings.sent3: The carpophore of the plant threw a fruit party for the other plant parts.
meanings.sent4: The carpophore of the vine embraced the grapes like a proud parent.
meanings.sent5: The carpophore gleamed under the sun, showcasing the plant's success in bearing fruit.
